page.title: 06Bulk Milk Collection.
page.content: In 1964 Mr.D.Weaver bought a farm in Park Lane,Endon.The previous owner possessed five lorries which he used to collect milk from local farms and send it to the dairy.Now Mr.Weaver has nineteen milk tankers.The milk is taken from a radius of fifty kilometres for the Milk Marketing Board who in turn sell it to the dairy.The Board pay Mr. Weaver haulage fees.Half the milk is used for liquid milk consumption,some for cheese,butter and yoghurt making and the rest for powdered milk.Each week Mr.Weaver sends milk samples from every farm visited to the Board to check for traces of antibiotic.If any are present in the milk it can't be sold because it spoils the starter for cheese making.In the tanker the milk is kept at a constant temperature of under five degrees centigrade in order to prevent the growth of bacteria.
